exceptions.exn: In environment A1 : Type A2 : Type B1 : Type B2 : Type RA : rel A1 A2 RB : rel B1 B2 f : A1 -> B1 g : A2 -> B2 m : A1 n : A2 P, Q : Prop H : RElim RB (f m) (g n) P Q x : (RA ++> RB)%rel f g y : RA m n /\\ P Unable to unify "?M1472 /\\ ?M1473" with "P".

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
A1: Type
A2: Type
B1: Type
B2: Type
RA: rel A1 A2
RB: rel B1 B2
f: A1 -> B1
g: A2 -> B2
m: A1
n: A2
Q: Prop
P: Prop

Goal:
RElim RB (f m) (g n) P Q -> RElim (RA ++> RB) f g (RA m n /\ P) Q

Premises:
RElim = fun (A B : Type) (R : rel A B) (m : A) (n : B) (P Q : Prop) => R m n -> P -> Q : forall A B : Type, rel A B -> A -> B -> Prop -> Prop -> Prop Arguments RElim {A B}%type_scope _%rel_scope _ _ (_ _)%type_scope
rel = fun A1 A2 : Type => A1 -> A2 -> Prop : Type -> Type -> Type Arguments rel (_ _)%type_scope
arrow_rel = fun (A1 A2 B1 B2 : Type) (RA : rel A1 A2) (RB : rel B1 B2) (f : A1 -> B1) (g : A2 -> B2) => forall (x : A1) (y : A2), RA x y -> RB (f x) (g y) : forall A1 A2 B1 B2 : Type, rel A1 A2 -> rel B1 B2 -> rel (A1 -> B1) (A2 -> B2) Arguments arrow_rel {A1 A2 B1 B2}%type_scope (RA RB)%rel_scope : rename
subrel_impl_relim : forall (R1 R2 : rel ?A ?B) (x1 x2 : ?A) (y1 y2 : ?B) (P0 Q0 : Prop), RElim impl (R1 x1 y1) (R2 x2 y2) P0 Q0 -> RElim subrel R1 R2 (x1 = x2 /\ y1 = y2 /\ P0) Q0 where ?A : [A1 : Type A2 : Type B1 : Type B2 : Type RA : rel A1 A2 RB : rel B1 B2 f : A1 -> B1 g : A2 -> B2 m : A1 n : A2 P : Prop Q : Prop |- Type] ?B : [A1 : Type A2 : Type B1 : Type B2 : Type RA : rel A1 A2 RB : rel B1 B2 f : A1 -> B1 g : A2 -> B2 m : A1 n : A2 P : Prop Q : Prop |- Type]
rexists : ?P -> ?R ?m ?n where ?A : [A1 : Type A2 : Type B1 : Type B2 : Type RA : rel A1 A2 RB : rel B1 B2 f : A1 -> B1 g : A2 -> B2 m : A1 n : A2 P : Prop Q : Prop |- Type] ?B : [A1 : Type A2 : Type B1 : Type B2 : Type RA : rel A1 A2 RB : rel B1 B2 f : A1 -> B1 g : A2 -> B2 m : A1 n : A2 P : Prop Q : Prop |- Type] ?P : [A1 : Type A2 : Type B1 : Type B2 : Type RA : rel A1 A2 RB : rel B1 B2 f : A1 -> B1 g : A2 ->...-> B2 m : A1 n : A2 P : Prop Q : Prop |- RExists ?P ?R ?m ?n]
relim_base : forall (R : rel ?A ?B) (m0 : ?A) (n0 : ?B), RElim R m0 n0 True (R m0 n0) where ?A : [A1 : Type A2 : Type B1 : Type B2 : Type RA : rel A1 A2 RB : rel B1 B2 f : A1 -> B1 g : A2 -> B2 m : A1 n : A2 P : Prop Q : Prop |- Type] ?B : [A1 : Type A2 : Type B1 : Type B2 : Type RA : rel A1 A2 RB : rel B1 B2 f : A1 -> B1 g : A2 -> B2 m : A1 n : A2 P : Prop Q : Prop |- Type]
rdestruct : forall (m0 : ?A) (n0 : ?B), ?R m0 n0 -> forall P0 : rel ?A ?B, ?T P0 -> P0 m0 n0 where ?A : [A1 : Type A2 : Type B1 : Type B2 : Type RA : rel A1 A2 RB : rel B1 B2 f : A1 -> B1 g : A2 -> B2 m : A1 n : A2 P : Prop Q : Prop |- Type] ?B : [A1 : Type A2 : Type B1 : Type B2 : Type RA : rel A1 A2 RB : rel B1 B2 f : A1 -> B1 g : A2 -> B2 m : A1 n : A2 P : Prop Q : Prop |- Type] ?R : [A1 : Type A2 : Type B1 : Type B2 : Type RA : rel A1 A2 RB : rel B1 B2 f : A1 ->...-> B2 m : A1 n : A2 P : Prop Q : Prop |- RDestruct ?R ?T]
arrow_rintro : forall (RA0 : rel ?A1 ?A2) (RB0 : rel ?B1 ?B2) (f0 : ?A1 -> ?B1) (g0 : ?A2 -> ?B2), RIntro (forall (x : ?A1) (y : ?A2), RA0 x y -> RB0 (f0 x) (g0 y)) (RA0 ++> RB0) f0 g0 where ?A1 : [A1 : Type A2 : Type B1 : Type B2 : Type RA : rel A1 A2 RB : rel B1 B2 f : A1 -> B1 g : A2 -> B2 m : A1 n : A2 P : Prop Q : Prop |- Type] ?A2 : [A1 : Type A2 : Type B1 : Type B2 : Type RA : rel A1 A2 RB : rel B1 B2 f : A1 -> B1 g : A2 ->...-> B2 m : A1 n : A2 P : Prop Q : Prop |- Type]
unfold_monotonic_rstep : forall (R : rel ?A ?B) (m0 : ?A) (n0 : ?B), RStep (R m0 n0) (Related m0 n0 R) where ?A : [A1 : Type A2 : Type B1 : Type B2 : Type RA : rel A1 A2 RB : rel B1 B2 f : A1 -> B1 g : A2 -> B2 m : A1 n : A2 P : Prop Q : Prop |- Type] ?B : [A1 : Type A2 : Type B1 : Type B2 : Type RA : rel A1 A2 RB : rel B1 B2 f : A1 -> B1 g : A2 -> B2 m : A1 n : A2 P : Prop Q : Prop |- Type]
rexists_rstep : forall (P0 : Prop) (R : rel ?A ?B) (m0 : ?A) (n0 : ?B), RExists P0 R m0 n0 -> NonDelayed (RAutoSubgoals P0) -> RStep True (R m0 n0) where ?A : [A1 : Type A2 : Type B1 : Type B2 : Type RA : rel A1 A2 RB : rel B1 B2 f : A1 -> B1 g : A2 -> B2 m : A1 n : A2 P : Prop Q : Prop |- Type] ?B : [A1 : Type A2 : Type B1 : Type B2 : Type RA : rel A1 A2 RB : rel B1 B2 f : A1 -> B1 g : A2 -> B2 m : A1 n : A2 P : Prop Q : Prop |- Type]
eq_subrel : forall R : rel ?A ?A, Reflexive R -> Related eq R subrel where ?A : [A1 : Type A2 : Type B1 : Type B2 : Type RA : rel A1 A2 RB : rel B1 B2 f : A1 -> B1 g : A2 -> B2 m : A1 n : A2 P : Prop Q : Prop |- Type]
reflexivity_rstep : forall (R : rel ?A ?A) (x : ?A), Reflexive R -> RStep True (R x x) where ?A : [A1 : Type A2 : Type B1 : Type B2 : Type RA : rel A1 A2 RB : rel B1 B2 f : A1 -> B1 g : A2 -> B2 m : A1 n : A2 P : Prop Q : Prop |- Type]
relim = fun (A B : Type) (R : rel A B) (m : A) (n : B) (P Q : Prop) (RElim : RElim R m n P Q) => RElim : forall (A B : Type) (R : rel A B) (m : A) (n : B) (P Q : Prop), RElim R m n P Q -> R m n -> P -> Q Arguments relim {A B}%type_scope {R}%rel_scope {m n} {P Q}%type_scope {RElim}
arrow_subrel = fun (A1 A2 B1 B2 : Type) (x y : rel A1 A2) (H : flip subrel x y) (x0 y0 : rel B1 B2) (H0 : subrel x0 y0) (x1 : A1 -> B1) (y1 : A2 -> B2) (H1 : (x ++> x0)%rel x1 y1) (x2 : A1) (y2 : A2) (H2 : y x2 y2) => (fun H3 : forall y3 : B2, x0 (x1 x2) y3 -> y0 (x1 x2) y3 => (fun _ : forall y3 : A2, x x2 y3 -> x0 (x1 x2) (y1 y3) => (fun _ : x0 (x1 x2) (y1 y2) -> y0 (x1 x2) (y1 y2) => H0 (x1 x2) (y1 y2) (H1 x2 y2...
related = fun (A B : Type) (f : A) (g : B) (R : rel A B) (Related : Related f g R) => Related : forall (A B : Type) (f : A) (g : B) (R : rel A B), Related f g R -> R f g Arguments related {A B}%type_scope {f g} {R}%rel_scope {Related}
Related = fun (A B : Type) (f : A) (g : B) (R : rel A B) => R f g : forall A B : Type, A -> B -> rel A B -> Prop Arguments Related {A B}%type_scope _ _ _%rel_scope
RDestruct = fun (A B : Type) (R : rel A B) (T : rel A B -> Prop) => forall (m : A) (n : B), R m n -> forall P : rel A B, T P -> P m n : forall A B : Type, rel A B -> (rel A B -> Prop) -> Prop Arguments RDestruct {A B}%type_scope _%rel_scope _%function_scope
rintro = fun (A B : Type) (P : Prop) (R : rel A B) (m : A) (n : B) (RIntro : RIntro P R m n) => RIntro : forall (A B : Type) (P : Prop) (R : rel A B) (m : A) (n : B), RIntro P R m n -> P -> R m n Arguments rintro {A B P}%type_scope {R}%rel_scope {m n RIntro}
rintro_rstep = fun (A B : Type) (P : Prop) (R : rel A B) (m : A) (n : B) (H : RIntro P R m n) => H : forall (A B : Type) (P : Prop) (R : rel A B) (m : A) (n : B), RIntro P R m n -> RStep P (R m n) Arguments rintro_rstep {A B P}%type_scope {R}%rel_scope {m n}
RIntro = fun (A B : Type) (P : Prop) (R : rel A B) (m : A) (n : B) => P -> R m n : forall A B : Type, Prop -> rel A B -> A -> B -> Prop Arguments RIntro {A B}%type_scope _%type_scope _%rel_scope
RExists = fun (A B : Type) (P : Prop) (R : rel A B) (m : A) (n : B) => P -> R m n : forall A B : Type, Prop -> rel A B -> A -> B -> Prop Arguments RExists {A B}%type_scope _%type_scope _%rel_scope
BinNat.N.mul_le_mono_nonneg_l : forall n m p : BinNums.N, BinNat.N.le BinNums.N0 p -> BinNat.N.le n m -> BinNat.N.le (BinNat.N.mul p n) (BinNat.N.mul p m)
RStep = fun P Q : Prop => P -> Q : Prop -> Prop -> Prop Arguments RStep (_ _)%type_scope
BinNat.N.mul_lt_mono_pos_l : forall p n m : BinNums.N, BinNat.N.lt BinNums.N0 p -> BinNat.N.lt n m < -> BinNat.N.lt (BinNat.N.mul p n) (BinNat.N.mul p m)
ssrbool.and5_rect : forall (P1 P2 P3 P4 P5 : Prop) (P : Type), (P1 -> P2 -> P3 -> P4 -> P5 -> P) -> ssrbool.and5 P1 P2 P3 P4 P5 -> P
ssrbool.and5_rec : forall (P1 P2 P3 P4 P5 : Prop) (P : Set), (P1 -> P2 -> P3 -> P4 -> P5 -> P) -> ssrbool.and5 P1 P2 P3 P4 P5 -> P
BinInt.Z.le_le_succ_r : forall n m : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.le n m -> BinInt.Z.le n (BinInt.Z.succ m)
BinInt.Z.even_add_even : forall n m : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.Even m -> BinInt.Z.even (BinInt.Z.add n m) = BinInt.Z.even n
BinIntDef.Z.sub = fun m n : BinNums.Z => BinIntDef.Z.add m (BinIntDef.Z.opp n) : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.sub (_ _)%Z_scope
ssrbool.prop_on2 : forall T1 T2 T3 : Type, ssrbool.mem_pred T2 -> forall (f : T1 -> T2) (Pf : (T1 -> T2) -> T3) (P : T1 -> T1 -> Prop), ssreflect.phantom T3 (Pf f) -> ssreflect.phantom Prop (forall x y : T1, P x y) -> Prop
BinNat.N.le_add_le_sub_l : forall n m p : BinNums.N, BinNat.N.le (BinNat.N.add n p) m -> BinNat.N.le p (BinNat.N.sub m n)
BinInt.Z.even_add : forall n m : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.even (BinInt.Z.add n m) = Bool.eqb (BinInt.Z.even n) (BinInt.Z.even m)
ssrbool.preim = fun (aT rT : Type) (f : aT -> rT) (d : ssrbool.pred rT) => ssrbool.SimplPred ((fun (f0 : aT -> rT) (p : ssrbool.pred rT) (x : aT) => p (f0 x)) f d) : forall aT rT : Type, (aT -> rT) -> ssrbool.pred rT -> ssrbool.simpl_pred aT Arguments ssrbool.preim {aT rT}%type_scope _%function_scope
Inductive Zis_gcd (a b g : BinNums.Z) : Prop := Zis_gcd_intro : BinInt.Z.divide g a -> BinInt.Z.divide g b -> (forall x : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.divide x a -> BinInt.Z.divide x b -> BinInt.Z.divide x g) -> Znumtheory.Zis_gcd a b g Arguments Znumtheory.Zis_gcd (_ _ _)%Z_scope Arguments Znumtheory.Zis_gcd_intro (_ _ _)%Z_scope _ _ _%function_scope

BinInt.Z.sub_lt_mono_l : forall n m p : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.lt n m < -> BinInt.Z.lt (BinInt.Z.sub p m) (BinInt.Z.sub p n)
BinNat.N.lnot = fun a n : BinNums.N => BinNat.N.lxor a (BinNat.N.ones n) : BinNums.N -> BinNums.N -> BinNums.N
ssrbool.subon2 : forall (T1 T2 : ssrbool.predArgType) (d2 d2' : ssrbool.mem_pred T2) (f : T1 -> T2) (Q2 : (T1 -> T2) -> T1 -> T1 -> Prop), ssrbool.sub_mem d2 d2' -> forall Phf Ph : ssreflect.phantom Prop (forall x y : T1, Q2 f x y), ssrbool.prop_on2 d2' (f:=f) (Pf:=fun f'' : T1 -> T2 => forall x y : T1, Q2 f'' x y) (P:= Q2 f) Phf Ph -> ssrbool.prop_on2 d2 (f:=f) (Pf:=fun f'' : T1 -> T2 => forall x y : T1, Q2 f'' x y) (P:= Q2 f) Phf Ph
BinInt.Z.log2_spec : forall n : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.lt BinNums.Z0 n -> BinInt.Z.le (BinInt.Z.pow (BinNums.Zpos (BinNums.xO BinNums.xH)) (BinInt.Z.log2 n)) n /\ BinInt.Z.lt n (BinInt.Z.pow (BinNums.Zpos (BinNums.xO BinNums.xH)) (BinInt.Z.succ (BinInt.Z.log2 n)))
BinNat.N.log2_spec : forall n : BinNums.N, BinNat.N.lt BinNums.N0 n -> BinNat.N.le (BinNat.N.pow (BinNums.Npos (BinNums.xO BinNums.xH)) (BinNat.N.log2 n)) n /\ BinNat.N.lt n (BinNat.N.pow (BinNums.Npos (BinNums.xO BinNums.xH)) (BinNat.N.succ (BinNat.N.log2 n)))
subrel = fun (A B : Type) (R1 R2 : rel A B) => forall (x : A) (y : B), R1 x y -> R2 x y : forall A B : Type, rel (rel A B) (rel A B) Arguments subrel {A B}%type_scope (R1 R2)%rel_scope : rename
Ring_polynom.mkPinj_ok : forall (R : Type) (rO : R) (radd rmul : R -> R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Equivalence req -> forall (C : Type) (phi : C -> R) (j : BinNums.positive) (l : list R) (P : Ring_polynom.Pol C), req (Ring_polynom.Pphi rO radd rmul phi l (Ring_polynom.mkPinj j P)) (Ring_polynom.Pphi rO radd rmul phi (BinList.jump j l) P)

```   
intros.
intros H.
intros x y.
intros H1 H2.
split.
- apply H, conj; assumption.
- assumption.

original: intros. intros H. intros x y. intros H1 H2. split. - apply H, conj; auto. - auto.
